name: Monastery Nights
description: The big brother to Monk Juice. A Strong Belgian Dark Ale brewed using the yeast from the fermentation of Monk Juice. A clean and rich beer with flavors of dried fruit. Strong but dry with clean alcohol flavor.

yeast: 1 yeast cake WLP550 Belgian Ale Yeast

brewing_instructions: Add 6 gallons of water to the kettle and add 1 Campden Tablet
Heat 6 gallons of strike water to 159°F
Add 6 gallons of water to the mash tun
Add all grains to the mash tun and confirm mash temperature of 149°F
Steep grains for 60 minutes
While steeping grains, heat 4 gallons of water for lautering to 170 °F
Fly spage until wort volume of 7.4 gallons is reached
Begin boil and wait for hot break
At 0 minutes, add 15 drops of FermCap to reduce foaming
At 0 minutes, add 3.0 oz Hallertauer Mittelfrüh hops
At 40 minutes, add 1.0 lb Amber Candi Sugar
At 40 minutes, add 0.5 lb Table Sugar
At 45 minutes, add 1.0 oz Hallertauer Mittelfrüh hops
At 65 minutes, add 1 tablet Whirlfloc
At 65 minutes, add 2 tbsp of yeast nutrient
At 65 minutes, add 1 oz Hallertauer Mittelfrüh hops
At 75 minutes, chil the wort to 68°F
Shake fermenter to aerate wort
Move wort to primary fermenter
Pitch yeast
Ferment at 67°F for 2 days
Ferment at 70°F for 3 days
Ferment at 72°F for 9 days
Cold crash to 36°F for 7 days
Move to keg and carbonate
starter_brewing_instructions: None - Pitch onto yeast cake from Monk Juice
